ext2API

Class BufferHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2API.BufferHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReadBufferHelper, WriteBufferHelper

    public class BufferHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Buffer buffer 
      protected java.nio.ByteBuffer data 
      protected Volume volume 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferHelper(java.io.RandomAccessFile file, int block_size, Volume vol)
      This is the parent class of the read and write helpers; these allow greater control of the buffer used to read from and write to the ByteBuffers that access the Volume.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferHelper

        public BufferHelper(java.io.RandomAccessFile file,
                    int block_size,
                    Volume vol)
        This is the parent class of the read and write helpers; these allow greater control of the buffer used to read from and write to the ByteBuffers that access the Volume.
        Parameters:
        file - This would be the file being read to or written from.
        block_size - This would be the block size of the file system.
        vol - This would be the file system volume.

    • Method Detail

      • readByteWord

        protected byte[] readByteWord(int size)
        This will read n bytes into an array and output that array.
        Parameters:
        size - This is the number of bytes read in at a time.
        Returns:
        This would be an array of the bytes read in.

      • get_inode

        public Inode get_inode(int inode_number)
        This will output an inode object given an inode number
        Parameters:
        inode_number - This is the inode number of the inode to be returned
        Returns:
        The inode object associated with the given inode number.

      • get_direct_pointers

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> get_direct_pointers(int inode_number)
        This will output an array list of the direct pointers of the inode associated with the given inode number
        Parameters:
        inode_number - The inode number associated with the direct pointers to be returned
        Returns:

      • get_all_pointers

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> get_all_pointers(int inode_number)
